content:
Here's the result of running `cat -n` on /workspace/benchmark/datasets/5-SimPO/SimPO/scripts/simpo_config.py:
     1	from dataclasses import dataclass
     2	from typing import Dict, Literal, Optional
     3	from transformers import TrainingArguments
     4	
     5	
     6	@dataclass
     7	class SimPOConfig(TrainingArguments):
     8	    r"""
     9	    SimPOConfig collects all training arguments related to the [`SimPOTrainer`] class.
    10	
    11	    Using [`HfArgumentParser`] we can turn this class into
    12	    [argparse](https://docs.python.org/3/library/argparse#module-argparse) arguments that can be specified on the
    13	    command line.
    14	
    15	    Parameters:
    16	        max_length (`int`, defaults to `None`):
    17	            The maximum length of the sequences in the batch. This argument is required if you want to use the default data collator.
    18	        max_prompt_length (`int`, defaults to `None`):
    19	            The maximum length of the prompt. This argument is required if you want to use the default data collator.
    20	        max_target_length (`int`, defaults to `None`):
    21	            The maximum length of the target. This argument is required if you want to use the default data collator and your model is an encoder-decoder.
    22	        beta (`float`, defaults to 2.0):
    23	            The beta factor in SimPO loss.
    24	        gamma_beta_ratio (`float`, defaults to 0.25):
    25	            The ratio between the target reward margin (gamma) and beta in SimPO loss.
    26	        sft_weight (`float`, defaults to 0.0):
    27	            SFT loss weight added to the SimPO loss (0.0 is not using SFT).
    28	        label_smoothing (`float`, defaults to 0):
    29	            The label smoothing factor. This argument is required if you want to use the default data collator.
    30	        loss_type (`str`, defaults to `sigmoid`):
    31	            The type of loss to use. This argument is required if you want to use the default data collator.
    32	        label_pad_token_id (`int`, defaults to `-100`):
    33	            The label pad token id. This argument is required if you want to use the default data collator.
    34	        padding_value (`int`, defaults to `None`):
    35	            The padding value if it is different to the tokenizer's pad_token_id.
    36	        truncation_mode (`str`, defaults to `keep_end`):
    37	            The truncation mode to use, either `keep_end` or `keep_start`. This argument is required if you want to use the default data collator.
    38	        generate_during_eval (`bool`, defaults to `False`):
    39	            Whether to sample and log generations during evaluation step.
    40	        is_encoder_decoder (`Optional[bool]`, `optional`, defaults to `None`):
